description: From Middle English sapient, from Old French sapient, or its source, Latin sapiÄ“ns. Doublet of savant.

adjectives.description: sapient (comparative more sapient, superlative most sapient)

entries.meaning: Attempting to appear wise or discerning.
(dated) Possessing wisdom and discernment; wise, learned.
examples: She had five or six cows; but it was observed by her sapient neighbors that she sold more butter every year than other farmers' wives who had twenty.

entries.meaning: (chiefly science fiction) Of a species or life-form, possessing intelligence or self-awareness.
(chiefly science fiction) An intelligent, self-aware being.
